title: How the Principle of Gurutva Functions Universally | Sri Madhu Pandit Dasa | SB 3.22.8 | 06.08.2024
speaker: HG Madhu Pandit Dasa

segments.key_quote: Swayambhuva Manu was concerned about getting his daughter married and obviously he had in his mind Karadvama Muni.
segments.summary: HG Madhu Pandit Dasa begins by reciting and translating a verse from Srimad Bhagavatam, focusing on Swayambhuva Manu's humble approach to Karadvama Muni, highlighting the importance of respect and grace in the guru-disciple relationship.
segments.transcript: om namo bhagavate vasudevaya om namo bhagavate vasudevaya Madbhagavatam, Canto 3, Chapter 22, Text 8 sabhavandh trasneha pariklishthatmano mama srotam arhasi dhinasya shravitam kripaya mune Translation in purport by S. D. V. Bhai Charanarvinda Bhaktivedanta Swamishila Prabhupada Translation O great sage, graciously be pleased to listen to the prayer of my humble self, for my mind is troubled by affection from my daughter. Purport by Srila Prabhupada: When a disciple is perfectly in consonance with the spiritual master, having received his message and executed it perfectly and sincerely, he has a right to ask a particular favour from the spiritual master. Generally, a pure devotee of the Lord or a pure disciple of a bona fide spiritual master does not ask any favour either from the Lord or the spiritual master. But even if there is a need to ask a favour from the spiritual master, one cannot ask that favour without satisfying him fully. Swayambhuva Manu wanted to disclose his mind regarding the function he wanted to execute due to affection for his daughter. Thus ends the bhaktivedanta purport. Swayambhuva Manu is seeking the attention of Karadvama Muni to consider his prayer with regard to something that is disturbing his mind or troubled by the affection for my daughter.

segments.key_quote: It is his free will to be pleased or not be pleased with me.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the humility required in approaching a spiritual master, emphasizing that pleasing the guru is not about earning mercy through service, but about the guru's grace and free will.
segments.transcript: Swayambhuva Manu was concerned about getting his daughter married and obviously he had in his mind Karadvama Muni. So he is saying here, O great sage, graciously be pleased to listen to the prayer of my humble self. This is how one addresses the spiritual master even if he has to, if he has to be addressed with respect to any request. See the humility. He is not just going and asking something. He is respecting him so much. He says, graciously be pleased. I am not saying that, I qualify that you be pleased with me. Graciously be pleased. Please be graceful. If someone asks somebody, please be pleased, I want you to be pleased with me. When is somebody pleased? When there is an exchange. The guru is pleased with the disciple when he receives service from the disciple. When he receives that, he is pleased with the disciple. But the disciple is thinking, just because I did service, even if he is pleased, it is because of his grace and not because of my contribution. Even if I do service, he need not be pleased. So he says, graciously be pleased. This is the way Swami Prabhupada Manu is addressing the spiritual master, as a disciple will address a spiritual master. So everywhere, in the relationship between guru and disciple, this is a very key point, that it is not a relationship of earning mercy or earning something by doing service to the spiritual master, you earn something. That is not the relationship. That is not the mood also. I will serve my spiritual master. It is his free will to be pleased or not be pleased

segments.key_quote: It is only by his grace it is reaching Krishna.
segments.summary: The lecture explains that a disciple's service to the spiritual master is ultimately offered to Krishna, and it is through the guru's grace that the service becomes worthy of reaching Krishna, as the disciple is unqualified to serve Krishna directly.
segments.transcript: with me. It is his own grace upon me, if he is pleased. That attitude is there because the disciple doesn't think that he can actually, he has the quality, humility to do pure devotional service to the Lord. The spiritual master is pleased with pure devotional service, because spiritual master, he is situated in a platform of absolute purity in his relationship with Krishna. So whatever service the living entity is offering to the spiritual master, naturally, the spiritual master doesn't want any service. He offers it to Krishna. Ekala, Ishvara, Krishna, Arasava, Brijya. Only Krishna is Ishvara. So a pure devotee of the Lord is offering pure devotional service. So when the disciple is offering service to spiritual master for Krishna to please him, the disciple knows that whatever I am offering is not worthy of going to Krishna. It is only by his grace it is reaching Krishna. The disciple never thinks that I can serve the spiritual master directly. I can serve Krishna directly. I can serve my spiritual master directly but I cannot serve Krishna directly. I have no qualification to serve Krishna directly. Krishna is surrounded and served by pure devotees of the Lord. So therefore, if at all my service has to reach Krishna, it is reaching Krishna because of the spiritual master's grace upon us. Whatever is lacking from the disciple, whatever the disciple offers to Krishna, it is pure devotional service. Whatever is lacking, the spiritual master compensates it and then offers it to the Lord.

segments.key_quote: One has to receive the message of the spiritual master regarding how to act in one's capacity for the spiritual master is expert in giving such instructions.
segments.summary: The speaker reads Srila Prabhupada's purport, emphasizing the importance of receiving instructions from a bona fide spiritual master and executing them according to one's capacity in Krishna Consciousness, highlighting the guru's role in guiding disciples towards perfection.
segments.transcript: Previous translation: I have fortunately been instructed by you and thus great favor has been bestowed upon me. I thank God and I have listened with open ears to your pure words. Purport: Srila Rupa Goswami has given directions in his Bhakti Rasamrita Sindhu on how to accept a bona fide spiritual master and how to deal with him. First, the desiring candidate must find a bona fide spiritual master and then he must very eagerly receive instructions from him and execute them. This is reciprocal service. A bona fide spiritual master, a saintly person always desires to elevate a common man who comes to him, because everyone is under the delusion of Maya and is forgetful of his prime duty, Krishna Consciousness. Saintly person always desires that everyone becomes a saintly person. It is the function of a saintly person to invoke Krishna Consciousness in every forgetful man. Manu said that he was advised and instructed by Kardama Muni he was very much favored. He considered himself lucky to receive the message, by oral reception. It is especially mentioned here that one should be very inquisitive to hear with open ears from the authorized source of a bona fide spiritual master. How is one to receive? One should receive the transcendental message by oral reception. The word Karna Randhrahey means through the holes of the ears. The favor of the spiritual master is not received through any other part of the body but the ears. This does not mean however that the spiritual master gives a particular type of mantra through the ears in exchange for some dollars and if the man meditates on that he achieves perfection and becomes God within six months. Such reception through the ears is bogus. The real fact is that a bona fide spiritual master knows the nature of a particular man and what sort of duties he can perform in Krishna Consciousness and he instructs him in that way. He instructs him through the ear not privately but publicly. You are fit for such and such a work in Krishna Consciousness you can act in this way. One person is advised to work in Krishna Consciousness by working in the deity's room another is advised to act in Krishna Consciousness by performing editorial work another is advised to do preaching work another is advised to carry out Krishna Consciousness in the cooking department. There are different departments of activities in Krishna Consciousness and the spiritual master knowing the particular ability of a particular man trains him in such a way that he becomes perfect. Bhagavad Gita makes it clear that one can attain the highest perfection in spiritual life simply by offering service according to his ability just as Arjuna served Krishna by his ability in the military art. Arjuna offered his service fully as a military man and he became perfect. Similarly an artist can attain perfection simply by performing artistic work on the direction of the spiritual master. If one is a literary man he can write articles and poetry for the service of God under the direction of the spiritual master. One has to receive the message of the spiritual master regarding how to act in one's capacity for the spiritual master is expert in giving

segments.key_quote: The faithful execution of the instruction which he receives from the spiritual master is the only duty of a disciple and that will bring him perfection.
segments.summary: The speaker continues reading Srila Prabhupada's purport, emphasizing the importance of faithfully executing the instructions received from the spiritual master as the primary duty of a disciple, leading to spiritual success.
segments.transcript: such instructions. This combination, the instruction of the spiritual master and the fateful execution of the instruction by the disciple, makes the entire process perfect. Srila Vishnu Achakravati Thakur describes in his explanation of his verse in Bhagavad Gita that one who wants to be certain to achieve spiritual success must take the instructions from the spiritual master as to what his particular function is. He should faithfully try to execute the particular instruction and should consider that his life and soul. The faithful execution of the instruction which he receives from the spiritual master is the only duty of a disciple and that will bring him perfection. One should be very careful to receive the instruction and execute it faithfully that will make one's life successful.
